title: Hero MotoCorp Q1 Results: Profit flat at Rs 1,126 crore, revenue falls 6%
summary: Hero MotoCorp's Q1 standalone net profit remained relatively stable at Rs 1,126 crore, with revenues experiencing a 6% YoY decrease to Rs 9,579 crore. The company saw strong demand for its entry-level and deluxe motorcycles, along with its 125cc scooter segment, while its...
fullContent: Hero MotoCorp's Q1 standalone net profit remained relatively stable at Rs 1,126 crore, with revenues experiencing a 6% YoY decrease to Rs 9,579 crore. The company saw strong demand for its entry-level and deluxe motorcycles, along with its 125cc scooter segment, while its electric mobility business under the VIDA brand gained traction.

Hong Kong confirms 3 new imported cases of chikungunya fever
summary: Hong Kong confirmed three new cases of chikungunya fever on Wednesday, comprising a woman returning from Guangdong province’s Foshan and a father and son who had travelled to Bangladesh. The Centre for Health Protection on Wednesday said that it was investigating the three...
fullContent: Hong Kong confirmed three new cases of chikungunya fever on Wednesday, comprising a woman returning from Guangdong province’s Foshan and a father and son who had travelled to Bangladesh. The Centre for Health Protection on Wednesday said that it was investigating the three imported cases. Health authorities said the woman, 79, lived in Southern district and had visited the mainland Chinese city of Foshan from July 1 to 31 to see her relatives. The patient was unable to recall being bitten by a...

title: Zambia’s Bonds Sink Most in Emerging Markets After IMF’s Warning
summary: Zambia’s dollar-denominated bonds led losses among emerging peers on Wednesday after the IMF warned that the country’s capacity to service its debt remains weak, dampening bondholders’ hopes for improved terms.
fullContent: Zambia’s dollar-denominated bonds led losses among emerging peers on Wednesday after the IMF warned that the country’s capacity to service its debt remains weak, dampening bondholders’ hopes for improved terms.
